cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 220 miles SE of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly drifting west-northwest today, then turning northwest to north and moving toward the central Texas coast near Matagorda/Calhoun counties Monday night–Tuesday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast near Matagorda Bay (between Port O’Connor and Freeport)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Aransas TX to High Island TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Aransas TX to Morgan City LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and upper Texas coast from Baffin Bay to High Island, and southwestern Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–55 mph with higher gusts) likely Monday into Tuesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water levels in Matagorda Bay, including Calhoun Port, could rise 2–4 ft above ground level at high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches of rain with isolated totals up to 20 inches possible, producing flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, minor river flooding, and possible port-channel restrictions.
